FacilityName: Nestle Prepared Foods Company - Solon, OH

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Nestle has made a commitment to provide all employees with a safe work environment and take whatever steps necessary to prevent injuries and illnesses resulting from at-risk acts or conditions during the hours of operation. Our goal as a company is to comply with federal, state and local laws. The entire management team has the responsibility of providing our employees with an environment conducive to an atmosphere of safety.



Ammonia safety is a priority within our facility. Our goal is to prevent problems, through the use of our preventive maintenance program that we enforce. The purpose is to identify and prevent potentially at-risk conditions and make necessary modifications before problems develop. Our on going program is designed to maintain the integrity of the system and assure that all employees are properly trained and meet the requirements to operate our equipment within the boundaries of our PSM/RMP program.





Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled;



Nestle Solon Plant produces and packages frozen prepared foods. The facility uses ammonia in its refrigeration system as a heat transfer medium. Ammonia is supplied to various end users in the processing of frozen foods.  Ammonia is the only PSM/RMP regulated substance handled at the Solon Plant.



Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has a level 3 accident release prevention program for the ammonia system that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard, EPA's Risk Management Program Regulations. The ammonia prevention program consists of the following elements:



A. Management System

A? Employee Participation

A? Process Safety Information

A? Process Hazard Analysis

A? Operating Procedures

A? Training Programs

A. Contractor Program

A? Mechanical Integrity Program

A? Hot Work Permit Procedure

A? Management of Change Procedures

A? Incident Investigation

A? Compliance Audit Procedure

A? Pre-Startup Safety Proc

edure

A. Emergency Planning and Response

A. Five Year Accident History

A. Risk Management Plan

 

 

 Five Year Accident History; 

 

 The facility has experienced one ammonia release over the reportable threshold in the five year history.

 

 

 Description of the Emergency Response Program;

 

 An emergency response program has been implemented at the Solon Plant. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to fires, ammonia leaks and other emergencies,including evacuation procedures for the plant.

 

 

 The emergency response program includes the following elements:

 

A? Ammonia Leak Procedures 

A? Emergency Evacuation Plan (Plant)

A? Fire Plan

A? Emergency Response Team Responsibilities





Planned Changes to Improve Safety; 



The facility is continuing to investigate improvements in the pressure relief system, the ammonia detection system,the ammonia control system, piping and refrigeration systems. We are continuing to update Emergency Response Procedures and have increased frequency of drills to test the procedures and implementing improved mitigation measures as a result.
